intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium prodanianum subsp. leucoglaucellum, commonly known as the white-leaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and flowering stems that bear yellow flowers. The leaves are typically covered in a whitish or grayish bloom, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
